subsection.name: What is BloomReach Version History Cleaner?
subsection.p: BloomReach Version History Cleaner provides the following features:

ul.li: On document publication, it can remove surplus versions or older versions automatically based on configurations. See Configuration page for details.

div.p: Some versions are used to keep internal branching metadata; technically the versions for the branching metadata contains multiple version labels. That kind of versions are excluded in the version history cleanup process.

subsection.name: Running Demo Project
subsection.p: You can run the demo project like the following:

div.source: $ mvn clean install $ cd demo $ mvn clean verify && mvn -Pcargo.run

subsection.p: The demo project is configured with default.max.revisions: 3. So, if you edit and re-publish a document more than three times, you will notice the older versions being removed automatically in order to keep only 3 versions in history.
